question.text: Which of the following keyword is used for including the namespaces in the program in C#?

answer.text: None of the above.

question.text: Which of the following converts a type to a byte value in C#?
Which of the following converts a type to a double type in C#?
Which of the following operator determines whether an object is of a certain type in C#?
Which of the following statements is correct about access specifiers in C#?

answer.text: Encapsulation is implemented by using access specifiers.
An access specifier defines the scope and visibility of a class member.
Both of the above.
None of the above.

question.text: Which of the following property of Array class in C# gets a 64-bit integer, the total number of elements in all the dimensions of the Array?

answer.text: None of the above.

question.text: Which of the following is the default access specifier of a class member function?
Which of the following is the correct about static member functions of a class?

answer.text: You can also declare a member function as static.
Such functions can access only static variables.
The static functions exist even before the object is created.
All of the above.

question.text: You can define one namespace inside another namespace.
Which of the following preprocessor directive allows generating a level one warning from a specific location in your code in C#?
We can use reserved keywords as identifiers in C# by prefixing them with @ character?
Which of the following defines boxing correctly?

answer.text: When a value type is converted to object type, it is called boxing.
When an object type is converted to a value type, it is called boxing.
Both of the above.
None of the above.

question.text: Which of the following converts a type to a 16-bit integer in C#?
Which of the following converts a type to an unsigned big type in C#?
Which of the following access specifier in C# allows a class to expose its member variables and member functions to other functions and objects?
Which of the following property of Array class in C# checks whether the Array has a fixed size?

answer.text: None of the above.

question.text: Which of the following is the default access specifier of a class member variable?
Operator overloading is a kind of dynamic polymorphism.
Which of the following preprocessor directive allows to create a compound conditional directive, along with #if in C#?
The System.SystemException class is the base class for all predefined system exception in C#?
Which of the following is a contextual keyword in C#?

answer.text: All of the above.

question.text: Which of the following is correct about Object Type in C#?

answer.text: The Object Type is the ultimate base class for all data types in C# Common Type System (CTS).
Object is an alias for System.Object class.
The object types can be assigned values of any other types, value types, reference types, predefined or user-defined types.
All of the above.

question.text: Which of the following converts a type to a 32-bit integer in C#?
Which of the following converts a type to an unsigned big type in C#?
Which of the following method copies the actual value of an argument into the formal parameter of the function?

answer.text: Value parameters
Reference parameters
Output parameters
None of the above.

question.text: Which of the following is true about C# structures?

answer.text: Structures can have methods, fields, indexers, properties, operator methods, and events.
Structures can have defined constructors, but not destructors.
You cannot define a default constructor for a structure. The default constructor is automatically defined and cannot be changed.
All of the above.

question.text: Which of the following is the correct about class member variables?

answer.text: Member variables are the attributes of an object (from design perspective) and they are kept private to implement encapsulation.
These private variables can only be accessed using the public member functions.
Both of the above.
None of the above.

question.text: Which of the following is the correct about static member functions of a class?

answer.text: You can also declare a member function as static.
Such functions can access only static variables.
The static functions exist even before the object is created.
All of the above.

question.text: Which of the following preprocessor directive specifies the end of a conditional directive in C#?
Which of the following preprocessor directive lets you specify a block of code that you can expand or collapse when using the outlining feature of the Visual Studio Code Editor in C#?
Which of the following is correct about variable naming conventions in C#?

answer.text: It should not be a C# keyword.
It must not contain any embedded space or symbol such as? - + ! @ # % ^ * ( ) [ ] { }
Both of the above.
None of the above.

question.text: Which of the following is correct about dynamic Type in C#?

answer.text: You can store any type of value in the dynamic data type variable.
Type checking for these types of variables takes place at run-time.
Both of the above.
None of the above.

question.text: Which of the following converts a floating point or integer type to a decimal type in C#?
Which of the following operator returns the size of a data type in C#?
Which of the following statements is correct about encapsulation?

answer.text: Encapsulation is defined as the process of enclosing one or more items within a physical or logical package.
Encapsulation, in object oriented programming methodology, prevents access to implementation details.
Abstraction allows making relevant information visible and encapsulation enables a programmer to implement the desired level of abstraction.
All of the above.

question.text: Which of the following property of Array class in C# checks whether the Array is readonly?

answer.text: None of the above.

question.text: Which of the following is the correct about class constructor?

answer.text: A class constructor is a special member function of a class that is executed whenever we create new objects of that class.
A constructor has exactly the same name as that of class and it does not have any return type.
Both of the above.
None of the above.

question.text: The comparison operators can be overloaded.
Which of the following preprocessor directive defines a sequence of characters as symbol in C#?
Which of the following is true about exceptions in C#?

answer.text: The exception classes in C# are mainly directly or indirectly derived from the System.Exception class.
C# exceptions are represented by classes.
Both of the above.
None of the above.

question.text: Which of the following converts a type to a Boolean value, where possible in C#?
Which of the following converts a type to a string in C#?
Which of the following converts a type to an unsigned big type in C#?
